message_1: In Matching Pennies, two players simultaneously choose either "heads" or "tails". If the choices match, player 1 wins a dollar from player 2. If the choices are different, player 2 wins a dollar from player 1. If they play this game repeatedly, what is the best strategy for each player and what is the expected value of the game for each player?

- If player 1 always chooses heads, player 2 can exploit this by always choosing heads as well, winning every time.
- If player 1 always chooses tails, player 2 can exploit this by always choosing tails as well, winning every time.
